pageContext.claim: “Also, in Wayne County, poll watchers observed canvassers rescanning batches of ballots over and over again, up to three or four or five times.”
pageContext.analysis: This claim largely stems from a affidavit that was filed by an alleged witness, Melissa Carone, a contract IT worker for Dominion. Wayne County Circuit Judge Timothy Kenny, who concluded that Carone’s “allegations are simply not credible.” The Michigan Court of Appeals panel denied an appeal of Kenny’s decision. Two of the three judges on the panel were appointed by Republican governors.
